content.title: Unfractionated Heparin in Vascular Surgery
content.description: Standard intraoperative anticoagulant used during vascular procedures to prevent thrombosis during arterial clamping and manipulation.
content.mechanism: Potentiates antithrombin III, inhibiting thrombin and factor Xa. Requires AT-III for activity.

reversal.protamine: 1mg protamine per 100 units heparin given in last 2 hours
reversal.considerations: May cause hypotension, anaphylaxis, pulmonary hypertension

hit.heparin_induced_thrombocytopenia: Immune-mediated (Type II HIT), 0.5-3% incidence; non-immune Type I occurs in up to 10% but is clinically benign
hit.management: Stop all heparin, use alternative anticoagulant (argatroban, bivalirudin)
